episodeTitle: Devil Fruit Powers! Kaku and Jabra Transform!
description: Zoro begins his intense battle with Kaku, who reveals his Devil Fruit power as the Ox-Ox Fruit, Model: Giraffe. Meanwhile, Sogeking attempts to steal a key from the sleeping Jabra, who awakens and transforms using his Dog-Dog Fruit, Model: Wolf. The CP9 agents' transformations provide both comedy and danger as the battles in the Tower of Justice intensify.

events.title: Zoro vs Kaku Battle Begins
events.description: Zoro begins his intense sword battle with Kaku in the Tower of Justice. Kaku claims to be CP9's best swordsman and demonstrates his ability to use Rankyaku slashes from his legs, calling it a 'Four Sword Style' combining his two swords with his leg techniques.
events.significance: This marks the beginning of one of the major battles of the Enies Lobby arc, pitting Zoro against a skilled swordsman with Rokushiki abilities.

quotes.speaker: Kaku
quotes.context: Kaku boasting about his swordsmanship to Zoro before their battle

events.title: Rankyaku Hakurai Technique
events.description: Kaku demonstrates Rankyaku Hakurai, a powerful leg-based slashing technique that matches Zoro's Nitoryu 72-Pound Cannon. The two attacks collide evenly, showing Kaku's mastery of Rokushiki techniques.
events.significance: Demonstrates Kaku's skill level and establishes him as a formidable opponent for Zoro, capable of matching his sword techniques with leg-based attacks.

events.title: Suzume the Rooster Appears
events.description: A small white rooster named Suzume appears in Jabra's garden area of the Tower of Justice. Instead of crowing, Suzume makes a chirping sound, which becomes important when Sogeking tries to sneak around.
events.significance: Suzume's debut serves as a comedic element that inadvertently foils Sogeking's stealth attempt.

events.title: Sogeking's Failed Stealth Mission
events.description: Sogeking attempts to retrieve the key from a sleeping Jabra but is startled by Suzume's unexpected chirping sound. His yell of shock wakes up Jabra, completely foiling his stealth mission.
events.significance: This comedic moment shows Sogeking's continued struggle with stealth and sets up the direct confrontation with Jabra.

events.title: Jabra Reveals Inu Inu no Mi, Model: Wolf
events.description: After waking up and punching Sogeking across the room, Jabra transforms using his Devil Fruit power, the Inu Inu no Mi, Model: Wolf, becoming a fearsome wolfman. This is the first time his Devil Fruit ability is revealed in the anime.
events.significance: Major power reveal showing Jabra's Zoan-type Devil Fruit ability, establishing him as a dangerous opponent and one of CP9's strongest members with enhanced strength, claws, and fangs.

quotes.text: I have the power of the Dog-Dog Fruit, Model: Wolf!
quotes.speaker: Jabra
quotes.context: Jabra revealing his Devil Fruit ability to Sogeking

events.title: Kaku Reveals Ushi Ushi no Mi, Model: Giraffe
events.description: During his battle with Zoro, Kaku reveals his newly acquired Devil Fruit power, the Ushi Ushi no Mi, Model: Giraffe. However, his first attempt at transformation accidentally results in a full giraffe form instead of a hybrid form, causing the floor to collapse under his weight.
events.significance: Major power reveal and comedic moment. This is Kaku's first time using his Devil Fruit in battle, received recently from Spandam. The awkward transformation becomes one of the most memorable comedic moments in the arc.

quotes.text: Is this Enies Lobby or a zoo?
quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro's reaction to seeing Kaku transformed into a full giraffe

events.title: Everyone Laughs at Kaku's Giraffe Form
events.description: After Kaku accidentally transforms into a full giraffe and falls through the floor to where Jabra and Sogeking are fighting, all three opponents laugh uncontrollably at his appearance. This humiliating moment greatly angers Kaku.
events.significance: This comedic moment becomes iconic in the series, showing that even serious battles can have humorous elements. It also motivates Kaku to master his hybrid form.

events.title: Seastone Handcuff Mishap
events.description: Sogeking finds unused pairs of seastone handcuffs and attempts to throw them at Kaku and Jabra to neutralize their Devil Fruit powers. However, in the chaos, one of the handcuffs ends up on Zoro's wrist instead, potentially hindering him in the battle.
events.significance: This comedic mishap adds tension to Zoro's battle, as he now fights with a handicap. It also demonstrates the continued chaotic teamwork between Zoro and Sogeking.

events.title: Kaku Achieves Hybrid Giraffe Form
events.description: After being mocked for his initial transformation, Kaku successfully achieves his hybrid man-beast form, combining his human intelligence and combat skills with the giraffe's physical advantages. This 'giraffeman' form startles Zoro with its unusual appearance.
events.significance: Kaku successfully masters his Devil Fruit's hybrid form, making him significantly more dangerous. This form will be his primary battle form for the remainder of the fight.

quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro's reaction to Kaku's hybrid giraffe form

events.title: Kaku Cuts the Tower of Justice in Half
events.description: Enraged by the mockery of his appearance, Kaku uses a powerful Rankyaku (Tempest Kick) technique in his hybrid form to vertically slice the entire Tower of Justice building in half, demonstrating the immense power boost from his Devil Fruit transformation.
events.significance: This showcases the devastating power of Kaku's Devil Fruit-enhanced Rokushiki techniques and causes massive structural damage to the Tower of Justice. It demonstrates that CP9 members are willing to destroy their own base to win.

events.title: Luffy Navigates the Tower of Justice
events.description: Luffy searches through the Tower of Justice looking for Robin, attempting to find a way to cross the whirlpools to reach the Bridge of Hesitation and the Gates of Justice where Robin is being taken.
events.significance: Shows Luffy's determination to rescue Robin and sets up his eventual path through the Tower to reach her.

events.title: Sanji Makes Tea for Kalifa
events.description: In an anime-original scene, Sanji encounters Kalifa in a bathhouse room and, being a gentleman, offers to make proper tea for them, critiquing that the water she's using isn't warm enough and offering his expertise as a chef.
events.significance: This scene establishes Sanji's continued chivalrous behavior even toward enemies, foreshadowing his struggle in the upcoming battle where his code of honor prevents him from fighting women.

events.title: Nami Questions Kumadori About His Key
events.description: In an anime-original scene, Nami encounters Kumadori and, realizing she's at a disadvantage, simply asks him directly for his key. Kumadori offers to show it but seems to have misplaced it, frustrating Nami.
events.significance: This scene shows Nami's practical approach to the situation and sets up the eventual battle between Nami and Kumadori.

quotes.speaker: Kaku
quotes.context: Kaku boasting about his abilities to Zoro

quotes.text: Is this Enies Lobby or a zoo?
quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro's reaction to seeing Kaku in full giraffe form

quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro's comment on Kaku's hybrid giraffe form

themes.description: Despite the serious life-or-death battles occurring, the episode maintains One Piece's signature humor through Kaku's awkward giraffe transformation and the reactions it provokes.
themes.symbolism: The juxtaposition of Kaku's fearsome CP9 reputation with his ridiculous giraffe appearance symbolizes that power doesn't always come in the form you expect.

themes.description: The episode explores how characters adapt to new abilities, as Kaku struggles to control his newly acquired Devil Fruit powers while in the heat of battle.
themes.symbolism: Kaku's transformation difficulties represent the challenge of mastering new strength and the vulnerability that comes with unfamiliar power.

themes.description: Each Straw Hat member navigates the Tower of Justice with unwavering determination to save Robin, despite facing powerful CP9 opponents.
themes.symbolism: The Tower of Justice represents the obstacle between the Straw Hats and their friend, with each floor and enemy being another challenge to overcome.

characterSpotlights.development: Kaku reveals his Devil Fruit power for the first time, transforming from a confident swordsman to someone struggling with an awkward new ability before mastering it.
keyActions: Reveals Ushi Ushi no Mi, Model: Giraffe
Cuts Tower of Justice in half with Rankyaku

characterSpotlights.development: Jabra reveals his Devil Fruit power, the Inu Inu no Mi, Model: Wolf, establishing himself as one of CP9's strongest members.
keyActions: Wakes up from Sogeking's failed stealth attempt

characterSpotlights.development: Zoro faces one of his toughest opponents yet, a swordsman with both Rokushiki techniques and Devil Fruit powers, while handicapped by a seastone handcuff.
keyActions: Witnesses and reacts to Kaku's transformation
quotes: Is this Enies Lobby or a zoo?

characterSpotlights.development: Sogeking's stealth mission fails comedically, and he faces the powerful Jabra alone, showing his bravery despite the overwhelming odds.
keyActions: Attempts to steal key from sleeping Jabra
Gets startled by Suzume the rooster

mangaDifferences.difference: The scene of Sanji making tea for Kalifa is anime-original and does not appear in the manga.
Nami questioning Kumadori about his key is an anime-original scene not present in the manga.
The anime adds a scene of a bee stinging Sogeking's nose, which is not in the manga.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the first time Kaku uses his Ushi Ushi no Mi, Model: Giraffe ability, which he received from Spandam only recently.
This episode also marks the first revelation of Jabra's Inu Inu no Mi, Model: Wolf Devil Fruit power in the anime.

sources.title: Inu Inu no Mi, Model: Wolf - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Kaku's accidental full giraffe transformation and the subsequent mockery became one of the most memorable comedic moments in the Enies Lobby arc.
The episode adapts portions of manga chapters 401 (pages 2-19) and 402 (pages 2-7).
Suzume, the white rooster who appears in this episode, makes a chirping sound instead of a normal rooster crow, which is the source of the joke when Sogeking is startled.
This episode uses the opening theme 'Crazy Rainbow' by Tackey & Tsubasa, which served as Opening 8 for episodes 284-325.
This episode does not feature an ending theme, as One Piece stopped using ending themes after episode 278 to allow for longer episode content.
Kaku's Doriki rating of 2200 makes him the second strongest CP9 member after Rob Lucci, while Jabra's rating of 2180 makes him the third strongest.
